verb.description: Lift or haul (a heavy thing) with great effort.
examples: she heaved the sofa back into place
he heaved himself out of bed
he heaved a euphoric sigh of relief

verb.description: Rise and fall rhythmically or spasmodically.
examples: his shoulders heaved as he panted

noun.description: An act of heaving, especially a strong pull.
A sideways displacement in a fault.
A case of retching or vomiting.
examples: waiting for the heaves to subside

noun.description: A disease of horses, with labored breathing.

phrases: the three canoes hove into view

origin: Old English hebban, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch heffen and German heben lift up.
